reviews.sentence: great hotel great location. Love the big room hardwood floors staff gardens and especially the three cats. Big nice rooms big bathroom beautiful gardens nice breakfast with great bagels. Fitness room is open 24 hours and decent. Yountvile is full of great restaurants and pretty walks and close to some of the best wineries. Room did not have a closet just an armoire in the bathroom.

week end getaway. I had been here perhaps 20 years ago and was pleasantly surprised that this inn is going strong and had been renovated to comfort and style. It was nice back then but we found it to be a great place to relax for our time in Yountvile. We had a second story room with vaulted ceilings and a small patio with furniture. There was lots of light and a nice fireplace a wine refrigerator that was appreciated a large and modern bathroom. A bottle of wine was placed in our room and the morning breakfast is huge and tasty. We were able to stay healthy with a custom made egg omelet and lovely fruit. Their pastries are made in house and worth the splurge. In the afternoon is a nice tea service that will sustain you until dinner. The bed was comfortable. I would recommend this for a little retreat. The gym is a five minute walk away and is small but has water towels and is just fine. The location is perfect for walking to the many fine dining establishments around town.

As wonderful as we remembered. We honeymooned here and had not been back so decided to celebrate our 25th anniversary by returning. We had vague memories but as soon as we stepped in our room it all came back. The high wood beamed ceilings wonderful fireplace and spacious yet cozy room was incredible. The large soaking jacuzi tub was perfect. Loved the LOcitane bath amenities. We used the fireplace so much and they never had a problem providing us with as many logs as we needed. The balcony was spacious. Loved the breakfast each morning with mimosas. Made to order omelets or eggs and something different each day. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The grounds are lush and beautiful. The only suggestion I would make is that if the staff knows someone is celebrating something perhaps when you book the reservations they should ask if it is a special occasion then have a card or something in the room to acknowledge. But other than that everything was perfect and we plan to return sooner than another 25 years. Lots of shops and restaurants that are walking distance. Small fitness center but it has the basics.

Very nice property lacks in service. My wife and I stayed here for two nights in late December as one of the stops on our Seattle to San Diego road trip. The property itself is very nice and and located within walking distance to all of the great restaurants. Our room was very nice and cozy. It was nicely decorated included a fireplace and the bathroom was quite special. We were situated in the back corner of the property which had an unsightly view from the balcony. We also did experience an early morning disturbance with a garbage truck which is obviously nobodys fault just something to keep in mind when checking in. One of the brightest spots of our stay was the housekeeping. They really went above and beyond. The attendant at the omelette was also great. Unfortunately that is where praises of the service stop. The front desk staff were not friendly or helpful for that matter. There was a specific incident with a front desk attendant upon check out that was very surprising to me. In short the attendant gave a rude response rolled her eyes and walked away after I calmly asked for clarification on a charge. It certainly was not the California chill we experienced on other parts of our road trip. I brought this to the attention of management several weeks later when prompted for feedback which went ignored. Whatever. If you run into better luck with front desk staff this is actually a pretty great spot. If you do not want to take the chance directing your rate in another direction might not be a bad idea.

Superb service and decor. I stayed at this hotel with my parents. Chris at the reception was genuinely welcoming and helpful. Everyone in the hotel seemed happy engaged and lively. The rooms decor deserves 5 stars. We had a fireplace and a complimentary bottle of wine. I would definitely stay there again and I am looking forward to going back. The pool area is great for chilling and Fridays complimentary wine tasting made our afternoon. Yountvile is in my favorite town in Napa Valley. Elegant and trendy. Food was yummy in a couple restaurants we tried.

Lovely hotel in quaint village. We booked the Vintage Inn for a two night stay to incorporate a wine tasting tour. Christina the concierge had been very helpful when we called from the UK and helped us choose the right tour. Our room was very nicely furnished spacious and the beds were fresh clean and very comfortable. Outside our room was a private porch area with ample comfortable seating. The breakfast offered a great selection and was regularly restocked. There is a lovely pool area and the rooms are set amongst beautifully manicured hedges and fountains. Our only complaint would be that our room 602 backed onto the car park with a very busy and noisy road to the back of it. We overcame the noise by blasting out the air conditioning but it did impact our time on the porch. I would definitely recommend staying here however ask for a room in the middle of the grounds away from the traffic noise.

Nice room. Clean room friendly staff convenient good value. Buffet breakfast and afternoon tea service are bonus. Great location if you are going to French laundry for dinner. Room is quite spacious and ask for second floor rooms when possible. Cute balcony and fireplace in every room. Would stay here again.

Perfect Getaway. Great room. Beautiful grounds. Excellent service and fantastic champagne buffet breakfast. We did not expect the bottle of wine in the room on arrival or the size of thr jucuzi tub for two. The staff was always willing to acomadate any of our requests.

Excellent Place to stay in Napa Valley. Wonderful rooms staff food service location pool gym. The professional staff made dinner reservations very easy. The breakfast was perfect. The Yountvile location is the best in the valley being centrally located making easy access to Napa St Helena Calistoga.

Read relax and walk to dinner. My parents and family members including my husband and I have been staying at the Vintage Inn for over ten years. The upstairs rooms have vaulted ceilings large shower tubs fireplaces balconies with two chairs or couches and comfortable beds. The rooms have been recently updated or will be soon. The lobby is getting a complete renovation making it more modern and upscale. In the meantime the reception is in a separate building and is even nicer than the old lobby. The temporary lobby has outdoor fire pits and an inside sitting room with a large screen tv or just a nice place to read. The breakfast which is included is one of the best we have ever had. Full of variety cereals hot and cold fresh fruit fresh danish and an omelet chef. We never need lunch. We also love the fact that there are so many great restaurants within walking distance. Botega and Bistro Jeanty are our favorites for dinner and R D for lunch. Get the cuban sandwich or the fried chicken sandwich. The best part of the Vintage Inn is the incredible staff. In all the years we have been staying at the Vintage we have seen very little turnover which says a lot. From Chris at the front desk all the way up to the general manager everyone is so efficient and wanting to please. The house keeping staff take their jobs very seriously and keep the rooms immaculate. Highly recommend staying at the Vintage Inn and when you do take time for relaxing on the balcony. It does not get any better.

A very expensive stay at a building site. We found it difficult to find the property even though we have stayed before. No signs on the road and I thought surely this building site ca nt be it. But alas it was. Heavy trucks going in and out the whole time and no proper lobby or pool. The breakfast was a slightly extended version of what you would get at a Motel 6 I think coffee and pastries in a soul less room. No turndown service and the balcony was pretty filthy clearly has not been cleaned in a while. Staff were friendly enough and the vibe relaxed but service just was not up to it for something that cost in excess of GBP50 a night. If you are going to price yourself alongside or above above the five star places in NYC and London you need to put a bit more effort in I am afraid. I have stayed in the Napa region 5 times this is the only time I am sure I wo nt be re visiting a property.

Anniversary overnight. We have stayed at the Vintage Inn for the last 5 years to celebrate our anniversary. We only live 40 minutes away but feel like we are a world away in Yountvile. We love this hotel and everything it offers thus the return visits. However we were very disappointed when we arrived to find that the hotel was under construction. We were unable to use the pool and the site was just not conducive to the relaxing time that we have had in the past. We were disappointed that we were not told of the construction and that no monetary consideration was given for the inconvenience. The three stars that I gave were an average of the usual 5 stars and 1 that I would have given the reservations desk and the quality of the stay this time.

Very different from the previous version of Vintage Inn. I come to this hotel almost every year for thanksgiving for the past 5 6 years. It used to be called the Vintage Inn. I was completely surprised this year that the reception hall has completely changed. Instead of the old fashioned building it has adopted an ultramodern design with a great deal of linearity and contrast between black and white. In the past many of the guests would like to sit in the reception area next to the fire reading or making converstaions. I notice that with the renovations guests probably find the style too cold for gatherings. The rooms are as spacious as before but has also been modified to a more Four Season atmosphere. There are disappointments. There are no longer afternoon tea with coffee cakes and sometimes wine. The breakfast offers much less varieties than in the past.

Breakfast skimp. Too Bad they are going Corporate. Have loved staying at this property and sister Vilagio for years and the Bell Staff was a true joy to meet and chat with every day. Unfortunately a few things happened that are disappointing and apparently driven by the corporate ‘ takeover’1. in the middle of our stay the breakfast which all the reviews rave above went from gorgeous to ghostly. You can get some food but all of the protein and most the extras cheese salmon capers tomato are on a ‘ new a la carte menu2. The free by desk staff had difficulty answering my questions about the area training is a must 3. All the gray suites guys looked the same and ran around doing. actually I do n’t know what they didBe careful before you bok there ’s a lot of construction most of which did n’t impact us but the Spa facilities were impacted. For 2019 Trip We will look for a different property for the first time in 14 Years.

Great Yountvile option. Having stayed at the previously named Vintage Inn I looked forward to staying at the remodeled House. We stayed in a loft suite which was large and wonderful. They did an excellent job on the redesign with modern comfortable and stylish furnishings. The huge bathroom and equally large TV are nice features. The other redesigned area that stands out is the large lobby building. Its beautiful but lacking much purpose. The breakfast area was moved to a nearby building and the bar was eliminated entirely. The relocated breakfast area works fine but eliminating the bar was an odd choice for a large property. There are nearby bars but why force a people to leave the property. With no bar or food service in the very large lobby building it seems like wasted space and we rarely viewed people in there. I suggest they rethink the use. The pool area is fairly unchanged and works out very nicely for post tasting lounge time. Keep in mind that this is not an adults only property so kids are often at the pool. I adore kids but I think bringing them to Napa is a curious choice. People have complained that the breakfast is not what it used to be. I thought it was perfectly fine. There is no omelet station but the food is high quality and there are ample choices. Keep in mind that none of the other high end Yountvile hotels offer any complementary breakfast so just enjoy it. A few quirky elements aside VH is definitely a place I had return to for Yountvile lodging. Its far from cheap but its in line with the other luxury hotels in the area. While this place is a great option there are a handful of other equally good spots including Bardesano Yountvile Inn and North Block. Vilagio is being redone and other properties are being built so much to choose from but you will not regret staying at VHRate tip if your schedule allows mid week stays the rates are considerably less.

Great central location in Napa valley. The bathrooms are amazing and the outdoor terraces could n’t be more relaxing and comfortable. The rooms themselves were spacious and gorgeous with a fireplace under the TV. The staff was incredibly helpful. If you needed something delivered to your room it showed up in minutes. Only negative for us was that there was no desk in the room for the bit of work we had to do during our stay. Yountvile is hands down our favorite town in Napa to stay in and Vintsge House is the perfect hotel and location.

No Hot Water Terable Service Staff. We had several issues with the stay Vintage house. First you can only communicate with the concierge via email. That would n’t be bad if they respond. But when I reached out to the concierge a few months before my stay a got a response and then nothing after 4 attempted emails. Finally after a 5th email someone got back to me 2 month later mind you letting me know this person was in the hospital. If you have a staff member on leave long term you need to ensure that clients are still taken care of. However I did try to connect with more than one person so the reasoning did n’t really fit. Then I emailed the concierge During my stay when I requested reservations to a well known restaurant the concierge emailed me they were not availble but could get me in the next day MONDAY when they were closed. When I pressed this issue your staff member claimed she misread my email. Not likely. A few other notable issues they literally left a bag of trash at our front door for 24 hours. The hot water ran out after 5 minutes. We have stayed here a few times but had never experienced so many issues. The hote despite the renovation needs to work on their staff. This is one of the more Resonable hotels in Napa so I guess you get what you pay for.

Really beautiful escape. Love this property so centrally located. The breakfast is a dream and a great way to start the day even if the coffee cups are impossibly small. Pool is excellent but bring your own beverage as service passes are few and far between.

Exceptional. It was beautiful and in a prime location with great amenities and food. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beds were advertised as queen beds but they were double sized beds. Although the staff was friendly they could ’ve been a bit quicker with fixing some of the minor issues that we had.

Wonderful Stay. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Vintage House. The location is great and within walking distance to the restaurants. If you do n’t feel like walking the staff will take you and pick you up. Try not to miss the beautiful walks though. The room was spacious and the fireplace was nice on the cool nights. The private patio was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nice sized with double sinks jacuzi tub and rain shower. The bed was comfortable the room spacious and they definitely pay attention to details. Polside service when enjoying the pool and hot tub. Great service beautiful grounds complimentary breakfast and wonderful rooms. We highly recommend.

Lovely place to stay. The friendly staff made our trip memorable. The valet met us the second we pulled in and took care of everything. We then were greeted with a glass of bubbly and checked in with more lovely staff members. The hotel is beautifully appointed and kept. The server at the pool was also very friendly and helpful. The only issue we had was the type of room I booked did n’t actually exist. I showed the front desk manager the room description on my confirmation and she said the room does n’t exist in the configuration that I reserved which was two queen beds with separate sitting area. Only exists with king bed. But I was charged for the upgraded 475 square ft room. This issue was n’t the hotels fault. I will return to the resort as I ’ve been there in the past and the service is top notch.
Exceptional. Limited room service options.
